subject: RE: [junit] How does Unit test in a heirarchy works...
msgSnippet: ... If you don t want to rerun the tests from the parent class, I assume that you are reusing some other code from it? What if you simply moved that code to a
messageBody:
Arun J wrote:
> Folks,
>
> I have a heirarchy of test cases.(jUnit/cactus based). Some
> test cases are run at the parent level and some are run at
> the child level. My observation is this. When I run my child
> test cases it traverses to the parent and runs the parent's
> tests also. My question is this..
>
> #1. Can I stop my derived Unit tests from running parent
> tests.?

If you don't want to rerun the tests from the parent class, I assume that
you are reusing some other code from it?

What if you simply moved that code to a common (abstract) base class and
don't any longer let the child class inherit from the parent class (but let
both inherit from the abstract base class)?

Cheers, Ilja
